did.abstract: A prospectus for the New York and Brooklyn Cab Company proposing expansion of operations into Brooklyn and utilize the same leasing method used in New York, dated 1885.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Judith and Peter Klemerer, 1986

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single document.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The New York and Brooklyn Cab Company began operating in Manhattan in 1884 and claimed a profit in its first year of business.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: New York and Brooklyn Cab Company prospectus, 1885, 1986.011; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A prospectus for the New York and Brooklyn Cab Company proposing expansion of operations into Brooklyn and utilize the same leasing method used in New York, dated 1885. Included in the prospectus is a description of the carriages used by the company.
